thread.title: Fayetteville Businessman Gets 1 Year for Defrauding First Security Bank
thread.title_full: Fayetteville Businessman Gets 1 Year for Defrauding First Security Bank

title: Fayetteville Businessman Gets 1 Year for Defrauding First Security Bank
text:
by Gwen Moritz on Friday, Sep. 4, 2015 12:59 pm Examples of construction equipment A. Camp Equipment offered for sale. 
Former Fayetteville businessman Andrew C. Judkins was sentenced Thursday to 12 months in federal prison and ordered to pay $438,500 in restitution for two counts of bank fraud. 
In March, a federal court jury convicted Judkins , now 43 and living in Bixby, Oklahoma, of defrauding First Security Bank of Searcy in a scheme that abused a revolving line of credit called floor-plan financing for his Fayetteville business, A. Camp Equipment LLC. 
Evidence presented at trial showed that Judkins submitted a fake invoice to First Security in 2008 that indicated that his business bought two dump trucks for $500,000 when he had actually paid $60,000 for the trucks in 2007. 
Then in 2009, he showed bank representatives a fake rental agreement indicated that one of the dump trucks — on which First Security had a $250,000 security interest — had been rented when he had actually sold it for $74,000 without repaying the bank. 
U.S. District Judge Timothy L. Brooks of Fayetteville also sentenced Judkins to two years of supervised release following his prison sentence.
